column4: hey guys, question, how do I exit the X server?  I did the ctrl-alt-backspace but it only brought to the log in part
you mean you want to go to a command line?
yes I want to install nvidia drivers
you can do that without going to a command line
but for the record sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
ok thank you, do you recommend not being in the terminal?  allquixotic cool makes sense, so shut down or best just stay on desktop and run the sh command here?
install your drivers without doing anything special
just install them from within a Terminal or however youlike
good advice thx allquixotic right thats the problem i am running into

ok hey i'm back, problem, whenever I try to install the drivers via terminal within x server i get an error message that says nvidia drivers cannot install while x is running, so I tried the sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop, all that happened was the screen shut off with a blinking curser I couldnt type with...so how can I install from within x? or without, whichever..
do you know how to select recovery mode on your boot menu?
boot to a root shell
yes
see thats where you loose me
shell?
select (recovery mode) from your kernel boot options.  Do you know how to do that?
then it will give you some options.  Select root shell
you mean when my comp first loads i have a choice of options of which partition or system to run?
Look at this.  Do you recognize a screen that looks something like this: http://www.pcmech.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/01/df8btqd3-64dndsgmd3.png
